media:group.media:title: Promo show
media:group.media:description:
This is fiction. None of the events depicted in this video actually happened, and are merely for entertainment purposes.

[SGI Mario model by the Render96 team]
https://linktr.ee/Render96
[Original floor 2B idea by Blackjoystick and Razer Bloxy]

Cancelled pilot for a gaming news show titled "Nintendo Mania" (possibly linked to the Mexican-produced show of the same name). The show is comprised of animated segments where a 3D model of Mario announces the latest gaming news, before transitioning into long stretches of gameplay.

This first episode features a pre-E3 1996 build of Super Mario 64, offering footage of cut areas in Peach's castle, as well as a playable Luigi.

The pilot was cancelled after test audiences reacted negatively to the crude humor and bad animation. 2 other episodes were reportedly written.

Very little is known of its production, apart from a writing credit attributed to a "Jim". Mario's voice actor remains unknown, though it is likely that these were simply placeholder recordings.

Nintendo's fun is eternal.
